name: Secret of the Forest (shinsukeito, Winged Souls, starling, Leh)
name_original: Secret of the Forest (shinsukeito, Winged Souls, starling, Leh)
description:
SECRET OF THE FOREST 🌳 

Many foresaw the world’s ruin, beset by ever-multiplying natural disasters as temperatures climb. However, in the depths of a forgotten isle the earth harbours a secret weapon… the mythical world tree Yggdrasil, which has the ability to convey its spirit to repopulate the earth’s surface! 

Play as a forest spirit to plant forests of different type, limited only by the currency of sunlight (generated by the trees you have standing) -- but beware, as each season passes your trees will need to weather the corresponding elements. 

CONTROLS  🐁

🌳  PLANT A TREE  - 1234 or click tree button, click destination 
✨ CAST A SPELL  - click planted tree (deselect tree first)
💗 HEAL YGGDRASIL - click world tree
🌏 PAN MAP - right click + drag

HOW TO PLAY 👌

This ruinous world is ruled by four deadly seasons - the Burns, the Rains, the Frosts and the Famine – and a fifth Fair season that passes without event. Weather the four seasons and their elemental disasters (fast-spreading fire, escalating flood, killing frost and slow-damaging drought) by planting trees! 

The more trees you plant, the more sunlight you will be able to use. But there’s a catch: you also need sunlight to cast tree-specific spells to remove the effects of each disaster, and to heal the world tree if it comes under siege. 

Nurture saplings for a year and they’ll mature into fully grown trees with higher defence, rewards and spell effect area. Each tree type counters a specific disaster, so be strategic in your planting choices! 

TO WIN 👑

Fill the world with fully grown trees! Fail to protect Yggdrasil, or lose all your trees and sunlight, and the world (and game) ends :( Replay to try out a different map + season order and adjust your strategy accordingly! Start on EASY mode, graduate to NORMAL or try out HARD mode 💪 We respect you 

CREDITS

Made with Unity & FMOD for the GitHub Game Off 2022 (theme: "cliche")
